intro: Betonica graeca, commonly known as Greek betony, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly woolly texture. Betonica graeca is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
